page.title: 02FARMING NEAR ANDOVER
page.content: {Middle Wyke}and{Lower Wyke}are typical of the many{small farms}in this part of Hampshire. Both grow fields of{wheat, barley}and{rape,}the oil from which is used for cooking and making margerine. Lower Wyke Farm has 140 head of{Fresians}which need to be milked twice a day and as the first milking is at 5 a.m., it's an early start for the dairy farmer ! Even small farms need expensive {machinery.}Although the{tractors}will be in use throughout the year, each farm's{Combine Harvester}or{seed {driller}may well be lying idle for all but a few weeks. Because the farmers rely so much upon their machines and because they are so expensive to buy, the greatest care is taken to look after them. On Middle Wyke Farm there is a{1947 Fordson tractor}which has been lovingly restored.
